title: Gary Neville admits old foes Liverpool feel like his title-winning sides with Manchester United
text:
Gary Neville has admitted that the current Liverpool team remind him of famous Manchester United title-winning sides.

The Red Devils legend won eight Premier League titles during his trophy-laden career at Old Trafford, but he has reluctantly conceded that Jurgen Klopp's men are showing the same strength as Manchester United sides that enjoyed 13 league triumphs under Sir Alex Ferguson.

Liverpool have a six point cushion at the top of the Premier League table and are yet to be beaten this season, with Manchester City their closest rivals for the title.

Gary Neville admits his old rivals Liverpool remind him of title-winning Man United teams

On Sunday the Reds came from behind against Tottenham to clinch a 2-1 win to extend their undefeated status, and Neville said they are showing the traits of champions as they grind out results - something that was key to success during the glory days at Old Trafford.

'I thought during the second half, I was going to say it on air but didn't, about the teams we played in at Manchester United,' he told Sky Sports.

'There is a complete trust in this crowd, they are brilliant to watch and they are scintillating.

'I agree with Jamie (Carragher) that there was only one winner at half-time and I thought that at 20 minutes to go.'

Liverpool have shown a gritty nature to their performances to remain unbeaten in the league

Gary Neville won eight Premier League titles with Man United in a hugely successful career

GARY NEVILLE'S HONOURS AT UNITED Premier League 1995/96, 1996/97, 1998/99, 1999/00, 2000/01, 2002/03, 2006/07, 2008/09 FA Cup 1995/96, 1998/99, 2003/04 League Cup 2005/06, 2009/10 Champions League 1998/99, 2007/08

Last season Liverpool amassed an incredible 97 points, but still missed out on the title as Manchester City finished one point better off, and Neville says it is only a matter of time before the team's performances bring the trophy they crave.

'They have played title winning football now for two years. You can't compare them to Man City. They are a completely different team.

'They are relentless and they should win a title playing the football and amassing the points they have.'

Liverpool were shocked early on against Spurs as Harry Kane headed home after just 47 seconds, but the team pressed on with confidence, sensing a goal would arrive and it came just after half time.

Jordan Henderson rifled home from an angle before Serge Aurier's foul on Sadio Mane gifted the Reds a penalty with 15 minutes from time, with Mo Salah converting to prolong the team's incredible start to the season.
description: The Red Devils legend won eight Premier League titles during his career at Old Trafford, but he has conceded that Jurgen Klopp's men are showing similarities to Alex Ferguson's sides.
